abstract: The three-letter ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the product.
overview:
## Discussion

The currency property contains an ISO 4217 alpha-3 string that represents the currency of the price of the product.

Don’t use the [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/currency] value to infer the storefront. Use the [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/storefront] value in the transaction instead.

For more information on how you set prices, see [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/manage-app-pricing/set-a-price] and [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/manage-in-app-purchases/set-a-price-for-an-in-app-purchase].

# currency

**Type**

The three-letter ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the product.

## Declaration

```swift
string currency
```

## Discussion

The currency property contains an ISO 4217 alpha-3 string that represents the currency of the price of the product.



Don’t use the [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/currency] value to infer the storefront. Use the [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/storefront] value in the transaction instead.

For more information on how you set prices, see [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/manage-app-pricing/set-a-price] and [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/manage-in-app-purchases/set-a-price-for-an-in-app-purchase].

## Product price and currency

- **price**: The price, in milliunits, of the In-App Purchase that the system records in the transaction.
